reasoning: Term 'Early Rheumatoid Arthritis' lacks standard epidemiological definition. Could refer to: (1) early-onset RA (juvenile/young adult), or (2) early-stage/recently-diagnosed RA. Using general RA incidence estimate (~20-30 per 100k adults) with conservative assumption that term refers to incident RA cases (by definition 'early' in disease course). Confidence reduced due to definitional ambiguity and unclear population specification.
source: WHO estimates and rheumatology epidemiology literature (2000-2005)
